alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 5:46AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall is expected to continue. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following county, Barry. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 AM CDT, The Department of Transportation reported flooding from previous heavy rain in the advisory area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Exeter, Butterfield, Mcdowell, Jenkins, Wheelerville and Ridgley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
